intro: Erica astroites var. astroites, commonly known as the star heath, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces white or pale pink blooms during the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Erica astroites var. astroites is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate coastal conditions.
